channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Vaccine records aren't up to date for more than half of Ottawa, Toronto students assessed: public health
item.description: Over half of Toronto and Ottawa students lack up-to-date vaccine records, exposing flaws in Ontario’s outdated reporting system as measles threatens Canada’s elimination status.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How Canadian sport can begin to climb out of financial crisis
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Is Alberta headed for a general strike?
item.description: Organized labour in Alberta sets the wheels in motion for a potential general strike after Danielle Smith’s UCP government forced Alberta teachers back to work using the notwithstanding clause.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Boy in care of Burlington, Ont., couple 'would be alive' if taken to hospital as urged, psychiatrist testifies
item.description: The psychiatrist for a 12-year-old found dead in 2022 has testified at the weeks-long murder trial for two Burlington, Ont., women who were aiming to adopt him. “If the family brought him to the emergency department, we wouldn’t be going through this and the boy would be alive,” Dr. Shelinderjit Dhaliwal told Superior Court in Milton.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Air ambulance takes average of nearly 4 hours to reach patients in northern Ontario, inquest told
item.description: Representatives of the Ontario's air ambulance operation, Ornge, told a coroner's inquest that it’s still impossible to meet the Ministry of Health’s timelines for transportation of critically ill patients in the north, although response times have improved since 2021.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Receives Report on Future of Technology, Innovation and Productivity
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Trump's ‘Golden Dome' is not something Canada should be a part of
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Rob Ashton: Canada needs bold action for workers now
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Only Unionized Amazon Warehouse in Canada Starts Negotiating
item.description: Both sides have unresolved legal challenges before courts and labour relations tribunals.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Supreme Court striking down minimum sentences for child pornography called 'disgusting' by Conservatives
item.description: In a divisive decision, the country’s top court struck down the mandatory minimum jail sentences for accessing or possessing child pornography — deeming them unconstitutional.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Saint John police chief discusses future of force amid harassment claims
item.description: Amidst questions around the leadership at Saint John Police Force and allegations of harassment, Chief Robert Bruce said he intends to continue in his role.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Trump says Carney ‘apologized' for TV ad that scuttled U.S. trade talks
item.description: Trump said 'no' when asked if the U.S. will resume trade negotiations, but praised Carney and said the two still have a 'good relationship.'
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Police Presence at Health Sciences Centre 24-7 to Protect Health-Care Workers and Patients
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Judge suggests better addiction supports after Winnipeg overdose death
item.description: A Winnipeg judge is recommending improved addiction supports after examining the overdose death of a man living in a tent who had faced barriers in accessing treatment.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Vaccine records aren't up-to-date for more than half of Ottawa, Toronto students assessed: public health
item.description: Public health records for Ottawa and Toronto schools show that among the cohorts assessed this year, more than half of the students did not have up-to-date immunization records, which experts say exposes an antiquated system that's unhelpful in the race to boost vaccination rates.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: BC Confesses Concerns about a Pipeline Property Tax Cut
item.description: After a Tyee report, the legislature grapples with a change that could cost homeowners.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Alberta Teachers’ Association might take the government to court. Here’s what we know
item.description: What avenues for legal recourse actually exist? CBC spoke to lawyers and civil liberty associations to get a sense of whether the back-to-work order could be challenged in court.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Photos: Electronic powerhouses Kaytranada and Justice co-headline Rogers Arena
item.description: The DJ and the French duo combined for a memorable show.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. grape grower left with unsold fruit as wineries allowed to import U.S. grapes
item.description: Some farmers say a provincial program that allows wineries to import grapes from the United States is crowding the market, leaving them with fruit they can't sell.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: From escaping war to building businesses: How some Ukrainians are investing in their future in Manitoba
item.description: When Olha Zolotkova arrived in Winnipeg just months after Russia’s mass invasion of Ukraine in 2022, she didn’t speak English. Now, she’s building her own business.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Only 10% of Canadian boomers say they'll travel to U.S. this winter: survey
item.description: The survey found most Canadians are going to be skipping U.S. travel this winter, with only 26 per cent saying they will head south this winter
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: What to know about Cowichan land title case in B.C. and push for ‘clarity'
item.description: A landmark court ruling has ignited fierce debate and uncertainty over the future of private property rights in the province and across the country.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Upset with new doctor law, students at all four Quebec medical schools vote to strike
item.description: Students at Quebec's four medical schools have voted for an unlimited general strike mandate over a new provincial law that ties part of doctors' remuneration to performance.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Reviewing Muslim representation in Canadian media
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Saskatoon police tactical team officer fired after hot tub party now charged with assault
item.description: A former Saskatoon police officer, fired in September with two other officers after an off-duty hot tub party in his backyard, is now charged with assault. Dylan Kemp is appealing his firing.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Measles Update #42
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
